intro: Callitriche berteroniana, commonly known as the narrow-leaf water starwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the Hydrocharitaceae family. It typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds, lakes, and slow-moving streams. The plant has slender, branching stems that are often submerged, with small, opposite, oval-shaped leaves. Its flowers are tiny, greenish-white, and clustered in dense inflorescences near the water surface. Callitriche berteroniana plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and fish.
